FuncDef:
The snmp-agent local-user password complexity-check disable command disables a device from checking the complexity of authentication and encryption passwords for local SNMP users.
The undo snmp-agent local-user password complexity-check disable command enables a device to check the complexity of authentication and encryption passwords for local SNMP users.
By default, a device is enabled to check the complexity of authentication and encryption password for local SNMP users.
CLIs: undo snmp-agent local-user password complexity-check disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The complexity requirements of authentication and encryption password for local SNMP users are as follows:
The minimum length of a password is eight characters.A password contains at least two types of characters: uppercase characters, lowercase characters, digits, and special characters that exclude question marks (?) and spaces.

Configuration Impact
After the complexity check is enabled, a configured community name must meet complexity requirements. After complexity check is disabled, a device does not check the complexity of community names.
Precautions
To improve user information security, enabling a device to check the complexity of authentication and encryption passwords for local SNMP users is recommended.
